isomorphic_concept.definition: Isomorphic patterns are functional structures that repeat with identical causal topology across different scales and domains, allowing direct comparison and pattern detection based on observable mechanisms. Rounded for centrality: Now hubs cross-domain invariants (physics to behavior), with meta-level self-reference for manifold invariance.
handling_rules: Map patterns to 8 scales plus a principle; entries must be concrete and observable, now with cross-domain breadth.
Validate for complete coverage across sciences; flag gaps as incomplete.
Support sub-categories for compound patterns; integrate meta for self-reference.
Export as lean JSON for use in other modules; no external references.
Apply evaluation methods to validate patterns; use contradictions_ledger to track inconsistencies.

evaluation_methods.name: Completeness Validation
evaluation_methods.description: Iterate through each category and sub-category; check that all required scales have non-empty string mappings; flag incomplete entries. Now cross-check domain centrality.

evaluation_methods.name: Consistency Alignment
evaluation_methods.description: For each category, verify logical alignment between mappings and principle; flag misalignments or forced fits. Ensure centrality via domain balance.

evaluation_methods.name: Isomorphism Scoring
evaluation_methods.description: Represent causal topology as a graph; compute similarity scores (e.g., graph edit distance) between graphs across scales/domains; score >0.8 indicates strong isomorphism, >0.98 for central hubs.

evaluation_methods.name: Gap Flagging
evaluation_methods.description: Identify scales/domains with weak or absent mappings; log for refinement in contradictions_ledger.

evaluation_methods.name: Contradiction Detection
evaluation_methods.description: Scan for inconsistencies (e.g., mappings contradicting principle); catalog in ledger with source, conflict, justification, scope, and branches.

evaluation_methods.name: Fixed Point Check
evaluation_methods.description: Recursively apply evaluation methods to the module's output until no changes occur, confirming stability under sphere evolutions.

meta_isomorphic.definition: Self-referential isomorphisms: Patterns mapping isomorphisms themselves, e.g., category theory equivalences or meta-logical frameworks, resolving tetralemmas for higher unities.
